alert.note: Alert for Rio Arriba (New Mexico) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Albuquerque (Northern and Central New Mexico)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued May 15 at 7:52PM MDT until further notice by NWS Albuquerque
info.description: ...The Flood Advisory continues for the following rivers in New Mexico... Rio Chama Near Chamita affecting Rio Arriba County. Rio Chama Above Abiquiu affecting Rio Arriba County. .Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. ...FLOOD ADVISORY FOR A DAM FLOODGATE RELEASE REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL FURTHER NOTICE... * WHAT...Snow melt and increased reservoir releases will cause the river flows to become high. Expect minor flooding downstream from the dam. * WHERE...Rio Chama above Abiquiu. * WHEN...Until further notice. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 7:00 PM MDT Monday the stage was 10.4 feet. - Forecast...The river is expected to rise to a crest of 10.5 feet early Friday afternoon. - Action stage is 10.2 feet. - Flood stage is 11.0 feet. - http://www.weather.gov/safety/flood &&
info.instruction: Caution is urged when walking near riverbanks. To report flooding, contact your local law enforcement agency and your National Weather Service office when you can do so safely. Additional information is available at www.weather.gov/abq. The next statement will be issued Tuesday morning around 1000 AM MDT.
